body.name: HP 14 Series 14" Touchscreen Laptop Intel Celeron N4020 4GB RAM 64GB eMMC Jet Black

body.description: The Jet Black HP 14 Laptop is designed to keep you productive and entertained from anywhere. Maximize your viewing area and see every detail thanks to 6.5 mm micro-edge bezel display, 79% screen-to-body ratio, and 14-inch HD (1366 x 768) display (1) (2). Not only does this micro-edge screen let you see more, but it also gives you intuitive controls to view your favorite content on this HD touchscreen. Performance, power consumption, and value come together in the Intel® Celeron® N4120, the ideal processor for your busiest days (3). Enjoy the highest resolution games and movies with the 4K-ready Intel® UHD Graphics 600 (4) (5). Store more of what you love and multitask faster, even with multiple windows open, with this touchscreen laptop’s 64 GB of eMMC storage and 4 GB of RAM (6). Up your creativity and efficiency as this HP 14-inch laptop offers even more features for computing from anywhere. Spend more time focused on your daily tasks and less on the battery life with up to 11 hours and 30 minutes of power (7). Plus, HP Fast Charge keeps you powered especially if you need recharge quickly (8). The exceedingly secure Windows 11 Home outfits your PC laptop with fast boot times, increased responsiveness, and added protection against phishing and malware (9). Work confidently with 1-year limited hardware warranty and stay connected with the dependable Wi-Fi 5 (1x1) and Bluetooth® 4.2 combo (10) (11). Boost your creativity as your Windows laptop comes with a 1-year subscription to Microsoft 365, including the whole Office Suite: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint (12). Productivity and entertainment features aren’t the only things your device is equipped with; lead a sustainable lifestyle with a thin laptop that is ENERGY STAR® certified and EPEAT® Silver registered (13) (14). (1) Percent of the active plus inactive viewing area to active viewing area plus border. Measure with lid vertical to the desk. (2) High-definition (HD) content is required to view high-definition images. (3) Multi-core is designed to improve the performance of certain software products. Not all customers or software applications will necessarily benefit from the use of this technology. Performance and clock frequency will vary depending on application workload and your hardware and software configurations. Intel’s numbering, branding, and/or naming is not a measurement of higher performance. Intel, Pentium, Intel Core, Celeron, Iris Xe, Intel logo, and the Intel Inside logo are trademarks of Intel Corporation in the U.S. and other countries. (4) Wireless access point and internet service required and sold separately. The availability of public wireless access points is limited. (5) Graphics output may be limited based on the maximum resolution of the display. Shared video memory (UMA) uses part of the total system memory for video performance. System memory dedicated to video performance is not available for other use by other programs. (6) For storage drives, GB = 1 billion bytes. The actual formatted capacity is less. Up to 5.1GB of disk is reserved for system recovery software. (7) Battery life tested by HP using continuous FHD video playback, 1080p (1920x1080) resolution, 150 nits brightness, system audio level at 17%, player audio level at 100%, played full-screen from local storage, headphone attached, wireless on but not connected. Actual battery life will vary depending on configuration and maximum capacity will naturally decrease with time and usage. (8) Features may require software or other 3rd party applications to provide the described functionality. Internet service required and not included. (9) Not all features are available in all editions or versions of Windows. Systems may require upgraded and/or separately purchased hardware, drivers, software or BIOS update to take full advantage of Windows functionality. Windows is automatically updated and enabled. High speed internet and Microsoft account required. ISP fees may apply and additional requirements may apply over time for updates. See http:// www.windows.com (10) Wireless access point and internet service required and sold separately. The availability of public wireless access points is limited. Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac) is backward compatible with prior Wi-Fi 5 specs. (11) Bluetooth® is a trademark owned by its proprietor and used by Hewlett-Packard Company under license. (12) Microsoft 365 Personal 1-year subscription included. Activation is required within 6-months of the Windows activation date. Microsoft 365 Family and Microsoft 365 Personal have non-commercial rights and are meant for personal use only. See microsoft.com for full details. (13) ENERGY STAR and the ENERGY STAR mark are registered trademarks owned by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. (14) Based on U.S. EPEAT® registration according to IEEE 1680.1-2018 EPEAT®. EPEAT® status varies by country. Visit www.epeat.net for more information.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Simple laptop for students or persons just doing light emails and documents etc. Purchased one for my 67yr old mom a year and a half ago and she requested the same one for her friend . Haven’t gotten any complains so I assume all is well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for me
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this device to diagnose marine engines. Super easy to take it out of S mode. Was able to download all the software I needed. Portable, it fits nicely in the service case. Charges fast and runs all day. Love the touch screen and super bright for outdoors.Just an important note....remember to keep it plugged in for the first initial start up. I guess it's a safety thing when it's ships.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Smaller than indicated in the description.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I purchased a used version of this HP laptop from "Busylittlebee" during the Amazon July Prime sale. It is lightweight, fast, & a bargain! Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Slower than a old sloth
reviews.reviewText: I was trying to get a simple computer to do basic work-related things and use youtube. It takes forever to load and won't let you download most non Microsoft products. Touch screen works fine, but the feature is wasted on the poor quality of the computer. If you have all day to watch this thing struggle to load and barely function, give it a shot. If you have things to do, avoid this POS at all costs. You get what you pay for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Okay the first thing it is touch screen but it doesn't fold back so the keyboard is always in your way you have to reach over it with a stylus to touch screen it and if you want anything to work on this you have to take it off s mode soon as I took it off s mode everything came in perfectly my printer you can download all the apps you.it does work with cricut machine

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Get it for under $100.00, yes, over, you can do better !
reviews.reviewText: After around 24 hours it has begun to wake up, especially after the long hours of seemingly endless UPDATES !Now that it is done with that, the touch screen is the first issue, it works fine but is NOT an IPS screen so getting situated to see properly does take some effort but in the end it's not too bad.The specs on site said it would have the Celeron N 4020 but this one came with the 4120 which has 4 cores rather than 2 so it can handle more and is a bit quicker.Everyday tasks are easy once you dive around inside and rattle around to see what all you can modify and for me being an Android user for 20 plus years, Windows is like taking a big step back in time.....5 moves to do one thing where Android and Chrome OS are one maybe two moves to one.The interesting thing with Windows 11 is how they have blended Google Chrome features with Windows, I guess if you can't beat them BLEND them and that is a very good thing!The laptop case itself is super nice if you hate wiping fingerprints off of everything, H.P. textured the surfaces and no fingerprints and easy to hang onto!Sound is good, picture eh so so, touch is...touch, it performs well, does very well with video's and once it gets on its feet it does quite good and this is coming from someone who swore off Windows over 20 years ago!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for basic use
reviews.reviewText: Purchased for 7 year old to replace chromebook. He had no difficulty with transition. This was not an S series as advertised, which is a bonus!
